body: Thanks very much for your quick reply,In cluster mode, the IP that all nodes publish is 0.0.0.0, which affects the service load?
Cluster and remote deploy need your real IPs.

- Sort will optimize in beta.
- Please provide more details.
- log can be changed. @hanahmily

是我服务端application.yml 配置有问题  改成本机IP（10.111.80.226）就好了

naming:
  jetty:
    host: 0.0.0.0
    port: 10800
    context_path: /
remote:
  gRPC:
    host: 10.111.80.226
    port: 11800
agent_gRPC:
  gRPC:
    host: 10.111.80.226
    port: 11800
agent_jetty:
  jetty:
    host: 10.111.80.226
    port: 12800
    context_path: /
analysis_register:

There is no GRPC   
Must the GRPC be started?
It's my own problem. I upgraded es to 6.2.3 API call error, sorry.
see doc, https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/How-to-build.md#build-from-github
Maybe you can debug on your env? Try to find what happens, and send a pull request?

@ascrutae  I have changed sofarpc componentId to be 32

Remote use real IP,There is an error,the following
"DEBUG 2018-05-15 08:36:36 DiscoveryRestServiceClient :  GRPC server list remain unchanged: [0.0.0.0:11800] 
ERROR 2018-05-15 08:36:37 AppAndServiceRegisterClient :  AppAndServiceRegisterClient execute fail.

"org.apache.skywalking.apm.dependencies.io.netty.channel.AbstractChannel$AnnotatedConnectException: Connection refused: no further information: 0.0.0.0/0.0.0.0:11800"

ok thanks ! There are some questions ,I know use apm-toolkit-opentracing set up Log and tags,But i when i use apm-toolkit-trace,find it only for tag ,it mean want to set up log ,i must use opentracing?

i meet the same problem, 
which version of elasticsearch do you use
This logs how your IPs in collector are not real IPs, still 0.0.0.0  Do you miss some IPs?
In doc, it said, 5.x
All IPs exception UI/Jetty, need to be changed into real IPs.
The internal toolkit is only for tag, now. You can send pull request to support log, if you want.
my elasticsearch is elasticsearch-5.6.6
The issue is caused by dirty data. Clear your es when you upgrade.

Thanks so much,Configure as you say,There is no error log,but there is no application in WEBUI;
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30229523/40037211-a0111e6e-583e-11e8-9960-90af69ac730f.png)
Check the FAQs. Maybe os time issue.
@wu-sheng I have merged the latest files from master branch and updated the markdown files.
@chidaodezhongsheng Your CI fails....
I recovery the `optional-plugins/pom` just like `apm-sdk-plugin/pom`, and I let the copy action be override by the plugin pom

> org.apache.skywalking.apm.collector.core.UnexpectedException: Received an instance heart beat message under instance id= 9 , which doesn't exist.

Agent is still running in old context. Instance ID and many other IDs are cached in agent sides. 

So my suggestion is, if you want to upgrade the backend or clear all data, make sure all agents shut down.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/17047124/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/17047124)

Coverage increased (+0.004%) to 23.511% when pulling **e10ceb8c507d805bc5b974c798a74c3620ce00ca on chidaodezhongsheng:master** into **a6e04c97ec5a9f251ec179dae09c56deb3d526b3 on apache:master**.
testcase has been updated at https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/skywalking-agent-testcases/pull/18
@ascrutae run some tests locally?

I have added Sharding-JDBC and commons-dbcp into the maven pom file by my local project to checked the dependencies. Indeed, only added jars: groovy, sharding, dbcp.
License and notice files have been checked, correct.

The issue cause by you had tag a custom component and the collector can't find it. [This document](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/Component-libraries-extend.md) may help you to define a custom component.
The test had passed. Here is the test report: https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report/blob/master/2018/5/candyleer/testReport-master-2018-05-15-21-18.md.
Thank @candyleer to provide new implementor.
ok thanks so much ，already deal it

This is current `optional-plugins` look like
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12181207/40092866-28311476-58f2-11e8-84b9-b67db29e711f.png)
In the `AntPathMatcher` , the most of the code is copied form Spring Framework. I only remove the superfluous method, and make some revise  in order to pass through  `checkstyle`.
I've never had such experience before, and I don't know what the effect of adding Apache license to the code will be.
I'm sorry about that. If this can not be merged, I think it might be possible to use these extended functions in the form of third party plugins.

![2018-05-16 10 49 42](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15340190/40093947-fd0cb48a-58f6-11e8-9b32-8b1e71a4fb0e.png)
Do you consider adding state filtering！！！！

> This is current optional-plugins look like

Sorry, I didn't make myself clear. I mean what look like in distribution? After your package, you should find it in `dist` folder, and unzip it.
@Rainbowboys I have just submitted the issue about this: #1231  and you can do this by yourself.

> After your package, you should find it in dist folder, and unzip it.

After unzip it,  the whole distribution like this
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12181207/40094807-9d8747d2-58fb-11e8-8aea-6f1f5581f3a1.png)
@SevenPointOld Good to share. I think it is good. The last thing before merge, is we have to process the LICENSE in right way. Let's wait our mentor's suggestion.

@wu-sheng, i do not know how strict ASF would be on this, because Spring is also under Apache 2.0 license. But you can't just transfer the copyright like that.

So to be safe I would take the approach of using `AntPathMatcher` from the original dependency. That original dependency can be stripped down to just the one class, and the package name refactored for safety. This can be done using either, or both, the maven dependency and shade plugins.

@SevenPointOld please use shade plugin to transfer this class from spring denpendency, rather then use code copy. like this https://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-shade-plugin/examples/class-relocation.html Please notice, only transfer the only one you need.

Based on this, I can trust on License.
@wu-sheng  Should I create a new module as a dependent transformation?
@SevenPointOld I think should add in this plugin module.

> I think should add in this plugin module.

What about the distribution look like this?
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12181207/40110582-eb90004a-5932-11e8-8eae-55525143bec8.png)
Why do you want the redistribition in the separated module and jar?

version updated. please resolve conflicts. and follow peng's guide. Thanks
Master codes version updated. Please follow. And resolve the License issue ASAP.

> Please notice, only transfer the only one you need

It's hard to transfer the only one, because of the Spring `AntPathMatcher` import some util class, the other util class also import others,  but they all belong to a same package, can I transfer the whole package `org.springframework.util`? exclude child package of course
Issue must be in English.

> @SevenPointOld 您的 classpath 里并没有 skywalking-plugin.def，请问 TraceIgnoreExtendService 是如何被 SkyWalking 加载的呢？ 

@brucewu-fly plugin.def is for plugin definition, such as: dubbo, sofa plugin. Service initialization is based on other mechanism. See `org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.boot.BootService` file.

> It's hard to transfer the only one, because of the Spring AntPathMatcher import some util class, the other util class also import others, but they all belong to a same package, can I transfer the whole package org.springframework.util? exclude child package of course

@SevenPointOld You can do a full package transfer, or rewrite the match logic. That is your decision.
@chidaodezhongsheng @oracle219 Could you finish this pr soon?
@wu-sheng OK, I will finish this pr now.
@ascrutae Look like an across thread situation.
No error was started, and rxjava-1.2.0 was called for error.
What is rxjava? I am not familiar with that.
hystrix calls rxjava.jar did the hystrix in my project and the hystrix in skywalking cause some exceptions?
@candyleer Do you need me to ping Xin for help? Or you want to try by yourself?
Look like same as  #1238

Please look your `application.yml` in your collector config directory. The following settings are alarm related. And I think it is easy to understand. 

```yaml
# alarm threshold
    applicationApdexThreshold: 2000
    serviceErrorRateThreshold: 10.00
    serviceAverageResponseTimeThreshold: 2000
    instanceErrorRateThreshold: 10.00
    instanceAverageResponseTimeThreshold: 2000
    applicationErrorRateThreshold: 10.00
    applicationAverageResponseTimeThreshold: 2000
```
I have no idea how to fix cause they are not in the same thread.

Then @ascrutae , please consider to refactor this plugin, as we just did for gRPC in beta. I think the old interceptor points have same issue. Some time, they are running in different thread by schedule mechanism.

Also include #1236 , I guess they are same.
Wow,I should learn how the grpc do

This is a Windows issue. I think you can set your register. @liuhaoyang @candyleer Have any of you done this in local? Maybe we could provide a FAQ for this. @peng-yongsheng @ascrutae @hanahmily and me are all using Mac all the time...
I haven't compile on windows...
@chidaodezhongsheng You are still missing @peng-yongsheng 's review.
`AsyncAppender ` is definitely a total different story.
And I will tag this as `enhancement`, because I didn't support that. before.
Ok, maybe should put traceId in `MDC` to support Async

> Ok, maybe should put traceId in MDC to support Async

Yes. I just don't use MDC often. But you can do that.

四三九九网络股份有限公司 http://www.4399.com/  
使用情况：目前使用的是5.0.0-beta 版本，即将在生产环境中使用。

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/17050016/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/17050016)

Coverage remained the same at 23.507% when pulling **ba74d4d5dd9b9b3604963814f5c78e89cdca2840 on wu-sheng-patch-1** into **a6e04c97ec5a9f251ec179dae09c56deb3d526b3 on master**.

I am making this automatically for both sync and async ,but i found this has been discussed in https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/pull/567,  I making the usage by `%X{tid}`
```xml
<configuration scan="true" scanPeriod=" 5 seconds">
    <appender name="STDOUT" class="ch.qos.logback.core.ConsoleAppender">
        <encoder class="ch.qos.logback.core.encoder.LayoutWrappingEncoder">
            <layout class="ch.qos.logback.classic.PatternLayout">
                <pattern>%d{yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS} [%thread] %-5level %logger{56} [%X{tid}] --- %msg%n</pattern>
            </layout>
        </encoder>
    </appender>

    <appender name="ASYNC_PRINT" class="ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender">
        <discardingThreshold>0</discardingThreshold>
        <queueSize>1024</queueSize>
        <neverBlock>true</neverBlock>
        <appender-ref ref="STDOUT"/>
    </appender>

    <root level="INFO">
        <appender-ref ref="ASYNC_PRINT"/>
    </root>
</configuration>
```
so i only just make this work in our internal team.

Yes, we didn't want any uncertain influence to end user. So, manual setting is better.

BTW, look like your team or company is using the project, can you submit your user case to the project?
Current trace module don't support this situation.   and this issue will resolve after the #1200 feature finished.
hi, @liuhaoyang @ascrutae @candyleer @peng-yongsheng @hanahmily I will finish this concept in beta2 for making the Java API can support more scenarios in async module library.
@ascrutae I will finish #1200 in these days, hope can help you.

@wu-sheng  I think that the `RuntimeContext` mechanism cloud make this feature better. The `RuntimeContext` can carrier some runtime object when the trace propagate within the same JVM, and it does not participate in serialization when the trace send to collector, it just for run time.
@ascrutae You should know, RuntimeContext is for the same thread too. Why does this help you? Also, I think that should be discussed in a separated issue.
oh, agree that. I will create a new issue for `RuntimeContext` feature.

@candyleer I want to be clear, Xin mentioned about current module can't support, right expression is can't use current module to build right trace segments, which match backend analysis. It supports to build trace, but will limit backend capabilities.

So that is why manual span is required. If you need more explanation, please let me know.
OK,I will submit when we use SW in production
manual span ,is it mean the span is propagated by object reference but not thread local?
I got into some trouble to implement manual span. Have to reconsider it. API is hard to review and make sure it works as expected.
@candyleer Yes, I used to want to fo this. But it is too complex, hard to explain the APIs. Try to have some new idea.
There is no `traceId` in response data. Can @peng-yongsheng help to handle this?
Can you provide some examples?
@wu-sheng I agree with your idea. We should support this feature in next major version which is not 5.0.0.
@leilianjie I am closing this. Run some search in Baidu or Google. There should be some solution for this. If you resolved this, please consider to provide FAQ doc.

@candyleer @ascrutae I have just understood Hytrix 's way. Look like the only way to support is, providing three segments for incoming request, request process and callback.

The disadvantage is the service dependency map doesn't work, because multiple threads means haven't direct dependencies, anything else should be OK.

I will remove the milestone, I have finish some prototype codes of this(branch manual-span), also make context-switchable(branch context-switchable)

Manual span APIs looks like every complex to use, and cost a lot to wait for the segment finish status.

So I have some doubts whether we should provide this. I will wait for more explicit requirements for both of them.

> Now,I have an application and it is slow in some machine, but i don't know which machine, so Do we need add hostname or other info to traceSegment or add tag to span?

There is an application id and instance id in every segment, which include application code, machine info, such as ip, hostname, processid.

I think I can move this into a query requirement for trace, to discuss whether could we provide this in beta2.
@hanahmily @peng-yongsheng What do you think about this in beta2? It makes sense in some cases. I am just not sure about the milestone.
@hanahmily some guess?
